"la-ur-07-0291" IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON IMAGE PROCESSING ; 200709 ; SAN ANTONIO. CHARTRAND, RICK. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star The authors show that using a nonconvex penalty term to regularize image reconstruction can substantially improve the preservation of object shapes. The commonly-used total-variation regularization, ∫  penalizes the length of the object edges. They show that ∫ sup p}, 0 < p < 1, only penalizes edges of dimension at least 2-p, and thus finite-length edges not at all. We give numerical examples showing the resulting improvement in shape preservation. AC52-06NA25396 Dimensions. Image Processing. Preservation. Shape. Los Alamos National Laboratory, researcher.
